KVIDIO wireless headsets are compatible with all devices that support Bluetooth or 3.5 mm plug cables. No worry for power shortage problem during long trip

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent budget headphones that punch above their weight class
reviews.reviewText: These sound excellent for the price. Not "audiophile grade", but that's nowhere near expected for $30. The value is ridiculous. Comfortable, lightweight, fits well without falling off or exerting painful pressure on the head over prolonged use. Battery life is VERY impressive, though I tend to listen at low to moderate volumes, which of course will extend the time between charges. The soft materials feel great, though I can't speak for longtime longevity of the pad covering for example, since I haven't had them for years.Overall, the sound profile is way more balanced than I would expect from a budget headphone. It genuinely sounds fairly accurate with surprising clarity. No frequency range feels too recessed, nor is it too in-your-face. Keep in mind, these aren't crystal clear, silky smooth, or perfectly even across the full frequency range, but those are characteristics reserved for a WAY higher price point and are completely unexpected here.- Bass reproduction is imperfect, not totally even, has some undesirable resonance in lower frequencies that can muddy the experience, but it's less of an issue than I'd expect at this price point. It's not way too overtuned, but it's also not anemic or lacking. Also, repositioning these on the head slightly can help with the muddiness. I'm pretty sure there's not a $30 headphone under the sun that actually has great bass reproduction, so definitely not knocking a star off for this. Worlds better than a lot of bass-boosted consumer headphones, without falling into the insipid tin can category.- Mids are pleasant and generally sit in the right spot in the mix. If you don't crank them up, they're not too harsh or "serrated-edged", but not buttery smooth either. More than acceptable, but can sound a little shouty at times. They will get harsher at louder volumes.- Highs aren't crystal clear, but don't feel too lacking or unnaturally excited. They won't present perfectly in a busy mix, but once again, nothing will at such a price. It's impressive how they're always serviceable, never totally getting lost or garbled while also not being painfully piercing.- Soundstage is just okay, but absolutely good enough for a super-affordable closed-back headphone. Like everything else, it's better at a moderate volume where things feel less compressed in general.They get really loud (too loud) from a regular source like a phone, whether over Bluetooth or a wired connection. The best sound quality will definitely come at a moderate volume though, since the drivers don't begin to present that "overmic'd" sound with a harsher edge as most do speakers and phones do closer to their volume limit, and separation will be better when they're not struggling.One of my biggest pet peeves—at least on my phone—is that every time they connect after turning them on, they default to the same volume, which is WAY too loud for me and can actually hurt my ears and leave me with an hour or two of discomfort and slightly reduced hearing acuity. Make sure to turn them on, begin playing your media and double-check your volume levels before putting them on your head to avoid this. I take pride in my sensitive hearing and this is very important.It's also worth mentioning that the volume control on the headphones themselves is awkward since it requires holding a skip button. This means it's hard to make a delicate adjustment, since you have to hold it long enough to change at all, but not so long that it adjusts too far up or down. I recommend finding the setting that sounds the best, then adjusting on your device from that point forward.Overall, these are a no-brainer if you want $30 over-ear bluetooth headphones with solid, accurate-but-acceptably-compressed sound quality, great comfort, stellar battery life and a completely solid connection even from several yards away.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy fit and amazing sound
reviews.reviewText: These headphones are great! They perform exactly as advertised and as I want them to. The battery lasts sooo long. I accidentally leave them on for entire days on end with no music playing and they'll still have battery to keep going when I return to them. They swivel for easy compactness if you wanna shove them in your bag. They're loud and deliver quality sound. They don't hurt my ears or head like other similar products have in the past. I think the colors are cute and reflect true in real life. They come with a charger wire and aux cord which is expected but not always a given with products similar to this one. I wear them at work so my co workers won't disturb me when I'm on my breaks, and so far they've served it's purpose. They're not 100% noise cancelling, but it does muffle noises out!! It connects easily to my phone, oculus, MP3 player (don't laugh I still use those) and my laptop. The sound clarity on phone calls is great, people have no issue hearing me.They're stylish, cute, affordable and functional!!! I don't know what else I could ask for when I buy headphones in this price range

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent headset at a great price!
reviews.reviewText: This wireless headset does the job for a super low price (under $30). It also comes with a wire if you want to use it plugged in. I'm using it with a dongle on an older laptap that didn't come with wi-fi installed. The clarity is not as good as the $200 headset I use with an i-pad I have. The treble is not as sharp and the bass not as distinct. The sound quality is good enough though - a lot better than using the laptop speakers. The headset is well padded and comfortable. Pairing it was very easy. All in all a good buy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent headphones for an amazing price
reviews.reviewText: I bought these to use when I listen to music, chat on the phone and sing. I don’t like in-ear headphones because they bother my ears. These are lightweight, produce a clear and clean sound and are easy to pair with my iPhone or use with the included wire. You can’t beat the value. They’re easy to transport, are compact and I only had to charge them once so far. I’ve used them for about 25 hours since purchasing them. So, they hold a charge well, too. I also have Bose headphones and while these don’t compare to those in sound quality, these are wireless. I highly recommend these headphones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Bang for your Buck!!
reviews.reviewText: Discovering these budget-friendly headphones was a pleasant surprise. Despite their affordability, they deliver a surprisingly good audio experience with crisp highs and decent bass. These headphones provide an immersive sound quality that rivals more expensive options, making them a solid choice for various activities, from commutes to workouts.What makes these headphones noteworthy is their thoughtful design. Lightweight and comfortable, they are ideal for extended use. The sturdy build and customizable fit with various ear tip sizes add to the overall value. Whether you're a student on a budget or someone looking for reliable daily-use headphones without a hefty price tag, they strikes an impressive balance between quality and affordability. These headphones prove that you don't have to break the bank to enjoy a satisfying audio experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: TL;DR: would recommend the headphones.Pros:- Can connect to multiple devices at once via Bluetooth (e.g. I can seamlessly switch between hearing audio from my phone and my laptop when it's connected to both)- Good sound quality at low volumes- Decent/usable microphone- Holds a charge for a long timeCons:- Audio quality is pretty bad at high volumes- Cannot use while charging- +/- volume buttons do not work on my devices (iPhone and Windows laptop)- "KVIDIO" is not a household name, so it may feel awkward flaunting their logo if you use the headphones outTo me, the pros are more important than the cons, so I love these headphones. The way it holds a charge was the most important thing to me, and it delivered on that front.

I recently purchased the Amazon Bluetooth Headphones Over Ear by KVIDIO and I'm thrilled with my purchase! The 65 hours of playtime is a game-changer, allowing me to enjoy uninterrupted music for days. The sound quality is impressive, delivering crisp highs and deep bass. The over-ear design provides excellent comfort, and the Bluetooth connectivity is seamless. I love the sleek and modern look of the headphones, and the controls are intuitive. Overall, KVIDIO has crafted a fantastic pair of headphones that exceed expectations in playtime, sound, and design. Highly recommended!
value for money does everything that is asked of them and is advertised

These headphones are amazing quality, I have had them for over 2 years and the sound quality is great, they are easy to connect to your devices, they fit nicely over the ears, the battery life is pretty good I can go two to three days sometimes longer depending on what I’m doing before I have to plug them in to charge. The price is good and well within my price range.
Muy buen sonido, y la duración de batería es lo mejor!
